body.name: DeepCool GAMMAXX GT CPU Air Cooler RGB Aura Sync 180w TDP 6mm x 4 Pure Copper Heat Pipes CPU Cooler with 120mm Fan PWM 1500RPM 56.5CFM for Intel LGA 1700/1200/1151/1150/1155 AMD AM5/AM4, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 15 hrs 8 mins
features: DeepCool GAMMAXX GT BK CPU cooler with four direct-contact heat pipes, 180w TDP heat dissipation to maximize overall cooling capacity and get a better gaming performance
Equipped with High speed 1500RPM PWM fan offers 56.5CFM airflow to contribute the air cooling system and keeps noise level under 27dB(A) even in full load with the noise damping pads
DeepCool GAMMAXX GT BK mounted with a decorative board on heat sink for highly recognizable look to make the sharp “Battlefield Armour Style” Gaming PC build.

CPU air cooler measures 135*84.8*157mm which is compatible with most ATX/ M-ATX PC case wihout blocking most RAM slots, though, checking CPU hight limitation of the PC case is strongly recommended before buying
RGB lighting can be controlled by motherboard with 12V 4-pin RGB port or cable controller, including ASUS Aura, GIGABYTE RGB Fusion, and MSI Mystic Light to build a mini world of light

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Based on 4 copper direct contact heatpipes and improved 0.5mm thickness fins, GAMMAXX GT BK includes RGB fan and RGB top cover which are synchronized to present striking light, controlled by RGB Ready motherboards or wired controller. It is also equipped PWM controlled function and delivers a maximum of 70 CFM volume airflow with low noise and turbulence, becoming excellent CPU cooling solution that provides minimum thermal resistance, excellent ease of use, and outstanding reliability. Application For Intel TDP 150W LGA20XX/LGA1366/LGA1200/1151/1150/1155 High End Desktop i9/i7 Core i7 Extreme/i7/i5/i3 Core 2 Extreme/Quad/Duo Pentium/Pentium G Celeron/Celeron G AMD TDP 140W AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1(NOTE: Manuals for AM4, please refer to FM2+/FM2/FM1/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2) Ryzen APU A12/A10/A8/A6/A4 FX 8/6/4-Core Phenom II X6/X4/X3/X2 Athlon II X4/X3/X2 Athlon X4
The GAMMAXX GT BLK V2 features sleek RGB lighting and optimized cooling performance for any spectacular RGB gaming rig.

Improved 0.5mm Thickness Aluminum Fins Upgraded 0.5mm thickness aluminum Fins with 4 solid copper heat pipes are designed for rapid heat dissipation, improving the cooling performance during operation.
Direct Contact Heatpipes Extreme high capacity of 4 copper heatpipes is installed with direct CPU contact for rapid heat transfer.

Wide Compatibility RGB lighting system can be controlled by RGB software with your motherboard. If your motherborad does not support RGB, you can use the included cable controller. Easy Installation With highly durable and enhanced backplate and clips and an all-new optimized mounting kit, installation is very easy. RGB SYNC RGB aluminum-made top cover and RGB fan are synchronized to present amazing colorful lighting effects. With motherboard software control, it can be SYNC with other RGB items.

GAMMAXX GT BK NEPTWIN WH ASSASSIN III CAPTAIN 240EX RGB WH CAPTAIN 240X WH CAPTAIN 360X WH Intel CPU Socket LGA20XX/LGA1366/LGA115X LGA20XX/LGA1366/LGA115X/LGA775 LGA2066/2011-v3/2011/1151/1150/1155/1366 LGA20XX/LGA1366/LGA115X LGA20XX/LGA1366/LGA115X LGA20XX/LGA1366/LGA115X AMD CPU Socket AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1 AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1 AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1 AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1 TR4/AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1 TR4/AM4/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2/FM2+/FM2/FM1 Dimensions (LxWxH) 5.3"X 3.3"X6.14"(135X84.8X156mm) 5"X 5.4"X 6.26"(126X136X159mm) 6.3"X 5.5"X 6.5" (161X140X165mm) 10.8"X 4.7"X 1.1" (274X120X27mm) 11.1"X 4.7"X 1.1" (282X120X27mm) 15.8"X 4.7"X 1.1" (402X120X27mm) Heatsink/Radiator 4 Heatpipes 6 Heatpipes 7 Heatpipes 240mm Radiator 240mm Radiator 360mm Radiator Fan Speed PWM: 500±150-1500±10%RPM PWM: 900±150-1500±10%RPM / Non PWM: 1300±10%RPM PWM: 400-1400 RPM PWM: 500±200-1800±10%RPM PWM: 500-1800 RPM±10% PWM: 500-1800 RPM±10% Fan Noise Level 17.8~27dB(A) 17.8~30dB(A) / 26.1dB(A) ≤34.2 dB(A) 17.6~31.3dB(A) ≤32.1 dB(A) ≤32.1 dB(A) LED/RGB RGB Top Cover and fan 2 White LED fans RGB waterblock and one strip RGB waterblock RGB waterblock Motherboard Header 12V 4-pin RGB CPU Fan 12V 4-pin RGB 12V 4-pin RGB 12V 4-pin RGB Motherboard Control ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Cable Controller (For motherboard without 12V RGB header) ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
reviews.reviewText: System info: Amd Ryzen 5 3600X, Asus TUF X570 mobo plus wifi, G.skill 32gb 3200mhz ram, WD sn750 1tb boot drive, SK Hynix Gold s31 1tb storage drive, Gigabyte geforce rtx 2070 super gaming oc 3x, Fractal Design Meshify C glass panel case.Got annoyed by the stock cooler that came with my cpu. It did the job, but that's pretty much the only positive thing about its performance. The Wraith Spire cooler always got stuck in this loud annoying feedback loop: Temperature rises past 45C, fan starts going into overdrive; temps fall down, fan slows and allows temp to rise again, thus starting what felt like a never ending cycle.I am pleased with this cooler's performance, noise, and aesthetics. The fan itself can be controlled via pwm, the speeds of which were far more flexible than the Wraith Spire for whatever reason. Idle temps are usually in the low 30s for me, with the fan being virtually noiseless under 50C. Load temps tend to hover just below 70C, occasionally crossing into and staying in the low 70s. The fan gets significantly louder at that point, but not what I would consider inhibitory towards concentration.Aesthetically, it's very pretty to look at and adds a nice pizzazz to a pc. Syncs well with my motherboard's native rgb control, cycling through colors to match the rest of the few rgb components I have installed. Only one color can be managed at a time though, at least for this model. I believe the newer addressable rgb version is a few dollars more, which Deepcool may eventually replace this model with.Installation was fairly easy, although there are a few points to watch out for. Contrary to the instructions provided by Asus, the native backplate of my motherboard needed to be removed in order to install the one included with the cooler. Also be careful to place the nuts provided into the appropriate backplate holes, as the "AMD" labelled hole is not, in fact, the same as the "AM4" hole. The brackets which hold the cooler in place also needed slight adjusting to match the hole alignment; you can very clearly slide the positions of the screws to do so. The wires are a bit too long imo, forcing me to hide them under the fan and behind the ram for the sake of good cable management. Obviously, some builds may require the length provided, so ymmv.Luckily, my case provided me access to the backside of my mobo, so installation was fairly straight forward aside from the few hiccups listed above. Can't really say anything about the inline controls provided since my build does not require it. Overall, this product is an excellent cooler with fantastic value at its $35 price point. Would recommend for midrange cpus.I'd add pictures to showcase the installation process, but amazon isn't letting me for whatever reason.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! This thing rocks!
reviews.reviewText: the pictures don't even do it justice, it looks 10x better than the pictures, trust me, This thing will turn heads and add serious aesthetics to your rig that you didn't even think was possible. Gone are the days of ugly bland air CPU coolers, This bad boy is the same price as the Hyper 212 and performs just as good with added RGB! You cant beat that. If you are on the fence on choosing this or the Hyper 212, Get THIS! Its freaking awesome. Keeps my Ryzen 5 3600 at 32C on idle and in games it never exceeds 62C.The mounting system is fairly straightforward and easy to install. Nothing but a simple phillip head screwdriver is needed for assembly. The only downside is that I had to remove the GPU from the PCI slot in order to get the fan clips over the heatsink because there was no clearance between the GPU backplate and the heatsink for my hand to fit to pull the fan clip on, But it wasn't that big a deal.the wiring system is not great but I get that the RGB probably cant be powered by the CPU fan header alone hence why it needs a spare SATA plug from your PSU. Other than that I have no complains at all about the controller. It works, You have to remove your side panel when you wanna change the colors but thats fine.RECOMMENDATIONS: Remove your GPU before installing to make it easier for you to clip on the fan. Also buy some spare paste, the stuff that comes with it was very generic and in a plastic pouch.PROS+ Quet+ RGB looks amazing, very vibrant+ Keeps CPU at same temps as a Hyper 212 EVO+ Installation mounts were very easy to line upCONS- Had to remove GPU to install the fans- Instructions could be more detailed- Included paste is crappy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You will be happy, I promise! This is coming from a PC builder and heavy gamer.
reviews.reviewText: I really liked the form factor of this cooler. Don’t worry. It may be cheap in cost, but not in performance. It does it’s job very well. I was idling my 9400f at 3.2 GHz at 27 C. (Stock intel cooler 38 C). This cooler is a pretty good bang for the buck. I was able to fit it in my Micro ATX build. It was close, but everything fit just fine. The fan was very easy to put on. They do supply thermal paste as well which was a plus because they don’t say they do. As long as you know what you are doing, this mounting kit they gave you was super easy to assemble. I highly recommend this cooler if you are trying to upgrade without breaking the bank. But if you are trying to overclock at max potential, I would get a Noctua cooler, but I was able to comfortably overclock my cpu and it was a very noticeable difference from the stock intel fan, so yes, if you were trying to do some overclocking, you can, but just know if you wanted every last bit of juice, you are looking at fans about $100+. But for my heavy gaming, this runs perfectly fine. Lastly the RGB is just a plus, I was able to plug it into my micro atx motherboard from gigabyte, and it had absolutely no problems. But if you do, it comes with a remote you can attach to Sata Power. And that also works.
Kvalite, tyst, effektiv, men tänk på att den är hög så den gick inte in i min låda.. eller, tja, plexiglaset bågnar ut lite så det gick. Men det var ju mitt fel och inte kylarens..

reviews.reviewTitle: Un perfect, et adieu le wraith prism bruyant et pas performant
reviews.reviewText: J'ai upgradé ma config il y a peu de temps, qui est dédiée principalement au simracing, et j'étais habitué a avoir des procos qui tournaient autour des 60°. Je sais que le Ryzen 7 3700X dégage pas mal de chaleur, mais en passant de mon I5 overclocké équipé d'un très bon Artic Freezer 13CO qui faisait très bien le job à ce dernier, je ne pouvais transférer ce très bon Rad car le CPU beaucoup plus large, n'était pas couvert sur la totalité. J'ai donc posé le Wraith Prisme d'origine dans un premier temps.Déjà ma tour est *a l'ancienne*, est avec un Airflow traversant allant de l'avant a l'arrière, pas d'extraction supérieur qui ne me conviens pas de toutes façons pour diverses raisons. Du coup le Prime qui lui est un rad classique qui dissipe la chaleur autour de lui, avec un ventilateur qui balance la chaleur en direction de la face latéral du boitier, est très mal optimisé pour respecter le flux d'air frais et répands la chaleur partout dans le boitier. j'avais donc des températures en charge du type 81° pour le CPU, 48° pour la CM, et 68° pour le GPU.Me voilà donc à la recherche d'un ventirad a prix correct, et surtout avec un montage allant dans le bon sens du flux d'air.A ma surprise, on trouve pas mal de ventirad qui ne sont pas orientables, et qui se montent dans une position faite pour extraire la chaleur vers le haut. C'est surprenant et ça m'a fermé pas mal de portes. Après, les avions de chasses @80€ en moyenne, pas pour moi c'est exagéré par rapport à mon utilisation. J'ai tronc trouvé intéressant ce Gammaxx qui avait l'air de regroupé tout ce que je voulais pour mon cahier des charges. Bingo, après une poignée de minutes pour faire le montage proprement, je lance la config et le verdict est sans appel.On passe de 81° pour le CPU à 63°, de 48° pour la CM à 43, et 64° pour le GPU! Le flux d'air est bien optimisé comme prévu, bien sur le CPU est le premier servi, mais tout le monde en profites car là où le Prime répandait sa chaleur un peu partout, maintenant les autres éléments ne sont plus pollués par la chaleur du CPU.Pour le montage j'ai fait presque un "tuto" en photo, et pour faire court il faut dévisser le support d'origine et sa backplate, donc accéder à l'arrière de la carte mère mais la pluspart des boitiers actuels ont une trappe à l'arrière pour le faire sans avoir à la démonter, afin installer celle du Gammaxx, bien choisir son kit selon son processeur, ici c'est donc pour une fixation AM4, ensuite perso je fuis tout ce qui est RGB var je ne fait pas du tuning et mon boitier est fermé et non transparent, alors j'ai enlevé le surplus qui se trouve sur le haut du radiateur et qui est maintenu par 2 petites vis hexagonales de 2, mettre de la pâte thermique, de l'artic silver pour ma part mais un petit sachet est également fournis avec le ventirad, et après avoir fixé avec les 4 vis le RAd sans le ventilateur de monté, monter ce dernier et le brancher là où il faut.Petit conseil, accrochez la petite broche métallique qui sert a clipser le ventilateur du coté le moins accessible en premier, sinon c'est un peu délicat pour passer les doigts.Et on ne va pas oublié le coté nuisances sonores au passage.. terminé l'aéroport qui était dans votre PC et qui lorsque le processeur était en charge était insupportable. Maintenant c'est la carte graphique que vous allez devoir supporter, car pour le coup on n'entends plus celui du CPU!Voilà, le tour est joué, je recommande à fond ce rad qui pour le prix est vraiment vraiment performant et bien fini, même si le seul petit truc qu'ils pourraient amélioré, c'est l'état de surface de la base du ventirad, qui demanderait à être surfacé pour niveler les heatpipes avec le support(voir photo), mais ça ne serait pas le même prix, et du coup si vous êtes bricoleurs, vous savez qu'il y a encore quelques degrés à gagner par ici ;)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: Good value for the money, amazing look
reviews.reviewText: Amazing cooler for the price and includes nice BLINK to it (RGB).I'm using it on Ryzen 7 3700x and I've tried couple of different configurations so bare with me bellow. Unfortunately have pictures only on my current one but I'm happy to answer questions if someone interested.So, I did following options:Opt1: Stock AMD Wraith Prism CoolerOpt2: DeepCool Gammax with one Stock RF120 fanOpt3: DeepCool Gammax with two DeepCool RF120 fansOpt4: DeepCool Gammax with two Arctic P12 (my current setup on the pictures)The noise levels are acceptable if the CPU isn't overclocked in all configurations except the stock AMD cooler. (To noisy for me in continuous gaming or working sessions)At the moment my CPU is overclocked to 4425 Mhz on all cores @1.3625v and max temp under load with AIDA 64 is 79C with fans at 90%If i load my CPU and extremely hot GPU to 100% simultaneously CPU temps are rising to 85C, but this 8s limitations of my case with the GPU (Corsair Carbide 275r & 5700 XT - XFX THICK III Ultra.My idle temp is 42 - 49C @4425 Mhz and 36-39C @3600Mhz.So my conclusion is:Gammax can handle mild overclock with stock fan on acceptable noise levels. If you have extra 120 mm fan you can add one as DeepCool include extra set of mouthing springs/brackets in the box.In my opinion is best looking Budget friendly CPU cooler, regardless if you're using the RGB or not.Hopefully this is helpful to someone! Stay safe!

Ich bin von einem 2600er auf den 3600er Ryzen umgestiegen. Habe das System bis dato prima mit dem Wraith Prism (Standartkühler vom 3700X) betrieben. Nach dem Wechsel musste ich aber feststellen, dass die neue CPU ganz schön heiß wird.Der Prism Wraith hat beim Zocken (BF5, Ultra, 3440x1440) die CPU bis 86°C erhitzt und hat dabei mit 3000 u/min gedreht. Das war für das Ohr nicht wirklich schön. Takt der CPU lag dann nur noch bei 3800Mhz.Durch den neuen Gammaxx GT liegt die Temperatur nun bei max 76°C und der Lüfter dreht bisher auf maximal 1150 u/min. Das ist eine wahre Wohltat. Von der Geräuschkulisse würde ich es als wahrnehmbahres, leises Rauschen beschreiben. In keinster Weise penetrant oder störend. Durch die knappe 10° Differenz bleibt der Takt der CPU nun auch im Bereich von 3950-3900Mhz.PBO also Precision Overboost ist im Bios aktiviert, manuell übertaktet ist nichts. Die Leistung langt mir. Bei Singlecore Anwendungen liegt der Boosttakt über 4000 / 4100 Mhz. Noch hatte ich nicht viel Zeit für ausgiebige Tests, aber vom ersten Eindruck bringt der neue Lüfter genau das, was ich mir gewünscht habe.Niedrige Temperaturen und DEUTLICH weniger Geräuschkulisse, durch die Verbesserung auch etwas höheren Takt und gleich mal 100Pkt mehr im Cinebench20.Im Desktopbetrieb läuft der Lüfter aktuell auf ca. 850 u/min. Die Peaks, welcher der 3600er mit sich bringt werden entspannt abgefangen. Die Temperatur bewegt sich irgendwo zwischen 40 und 60°C bei herkömmlichen Desktoparbeiten / Youtube / Netflix etc.Von der Lüfterkurve habe ich das ganze so eingestellt, dass erst ab 65/70°C der Lüfter langsam aufdreht (max 1200 u/min). Entsprechend habe ich im Desktopbetrieb so kein Lüfteraufdrehen mehr wahrnehmen können.Die RGB Beleuchtung sieht super aus und lässt sich über die Software von meinem ASROCK B450M Pro4 steuern.Das Gesamtsystem ist in einem Sharkoon TG4 mit 3 Lüftern In und einem Out (120mm). Diese laufen konstant bei 60% Geschwindigkeit (in meinen Ohren angenehm, daher lasse ich diese auch nicht weiter runterregeln).Das Gehäuse bietet Platz für maximal 160mm Lüfterhöhe, ich würde mit diesem Kühler nun von Maßarbeit sprechen. Größer dürfte er wirklich nicht sein :)Also Fazit - harmoniert super mit dem 3600er Ryzen, ist in meinen Ohren wirklich sehr leise und sieht echt klasse aus. Ich dachte ich trauere meinem Wraith Prism nach, weil der optisch wirklich ein Hingucker ist, aber das Thema ist definitiv erledigt, der Gammax GT ist optisch und leistungstechnisch ein deutlich besserer Nachfolger :)EDIT:Mittlerweile habe ich meinen Ryzen etwas undervoltet, läuft stabil mit 1.25V auf 4000 Mhz, dadurch liegt die CPU Temperatur jetzt nur noch bei 65°C - 72°C. Lüfter ist nach wie vor unglaublich leise, klare Empfehlung!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Estetica prezzo e prestazioni...Deepcool una garanzia a prezzi contenuti.
reviews.reviewText: Dopo qualche mese di utilizzo , non posso che ritenermi soddisfatto, dell'acquisto fatto, secondo me ,questo prodotto vale la pena esser comprato sempre ( secondo i prezzi deepcool) xkè ha un'ottima qualità prezzo ed in più è anche bello...Io l'ho preso con un codice sconto di deepcool di 10 euro e devo dire che mai ho speso meglio i miei soldi,il montaggio è abbastanza semplice e deepcool fornische la piastra per adattarlo ai vari socket,le temperature anche con questo calado estivo e con 30 gradi in camera, non superano mai i 50 51 gradi su il ryzen 5 2600 in un case sharkoon tg5 con ventole deepcool cf, quindi posso ritenermi più che soddisfatto....Altra chicca poi per cui posso ritenere ancor più valido questo prodotto,oltre le prestazioni e la rumorosità, è il secondo gancetto che deepcool fornisce nella confezione, quindi ,potete montarci una seconda ventola (se ne aveste bisogno, o per migliorare ancor di più la dissipazione quindi secondo me si può spingere anche per fare un'overclock medio o per un gusto estetico)...Prodotto consigliatissimo, chi poi lo ha preso al prime days, ha fatto un'affarone per il prezzo a cui è stato venduto, ma in generale è un'ottimo affare a tutti i prezzi che deepcool ha proposto.
